result.execSummary:
The defendant Ismael Roman Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $150.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ismael Roman Gomez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Ismael Roman Gomez in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.    Interpreter oath given by the Court.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves another copy of Complaint.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  If necessary, he would like an attorney.  Court discusses earnings with Defendant.  Due to Interpreter being present, Def requests to speak with the State on resolution to resolve matter today.  Back of Record at 2:02 PM:   ADA recites agreement reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 DC:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  Court Costs imposed which will include DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court - 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.
